turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: It seems your department doesn't believe out new unit is to the public benefit.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: A humanoid robot is like any other machine, it can be a benefit or a hazard.  If it's a benefit, it's not our problem.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: But because your department can't do an adequate job in detecting the miniscule number at large, it's a problem.  Correct, Mr. Deckard?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: For the responsibility of your power.  Being a police bureaucrat, you've got more than your share.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I wouldn't accept it.  Also, I'd report the person who gave it to me to the police.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You have a little boy.  He shows you his butterfly collection, plus the killing jar.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I'd take him to the doctor.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You're watching T.V. and suddenly you notice a wasp crawling on your wrist.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: In a magazine you come across a full-page photo of a nude girl.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Is this testing whether I'm an android or a lesbian?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You show the picture to your husband. He likes it and hangs it on the wall. The girl is lying on a bearskin rug.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You become pregnant by a man who runs off with your best friend, and you decide to get an abortion.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: That would be murder, Mr. Deckard.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Sounds like you speaks from experience.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Last question.  You're watching an old movie.  It shows a banquet in progress, the guests are enjoying raw oysters.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I know you think it complicates your work, but I'm here to help.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I've already got more help than I need.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I think you need more help than you've got.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: There's two reasons a man rejects help.  Either because he's so good at what he does he doesn't think he needs it, or he's so insecure he can't admit it.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Sounds like I'm an ass-hole either way, but the answer is still no.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Two of us might be more effective than one.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: You use your equipment, don't you?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: So, I'm a piece of equipment. Use me.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: They probably want to find out when they were made.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Don't just stand there looking at me.  It's not polite.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You ever take a bath with a man before?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: There's a lot I haven't done with a man before.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I told you I'd come back.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: You didn't hear me.  You were sleeping.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: How come you're not on the job?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I am.  Part of my job is to sit on a couch and try and figure things out.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: What do people do in the afternoon?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: If they are smart, they take naps.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Did you cry when your father died?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: That's another thing I can't do.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Nobody is freer than when he dreams.  I read that.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: It wasn't very good last night, was it?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I don't know, I have nothing to compare it to.  I guess I thought there was something more to it.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I don't know... I think I missed something.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: I'm not sure.  Is there a secret?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: When was the last time you cleaned this place?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Have you ever cleaned your apartment?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: It appears to be dirty -- why don't you get somebody?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: They could clean around the arrangement.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I don't like people snooping around my stuff.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: But if I don't plug it in how can I...

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Never mind the plug, just go through the motions.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I don't like the noise.  Just practice.  Practice makes perfect.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Good for a smart girl to feel stupid.  Part of your education.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Have you ever known anybody a long time?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Nope.  Nobody could stand me that long.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Why do you call it retire, why don't you call it murder?

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Don't you think anything that can suffer deserves to be considered?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Andies only simulate suffering -- if they're programmed for it.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: Do you think I simulated what happened between us?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Don't leave here.  Don't open the door, don't answer the phone.

turns.speaker: RACHAEL
turns.text: That some of the folks around here are more programmed then me.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: You know where I been.  I been on vacation.

turns.speaker: GAFF
turns.text: Next time you go on vacation, do me a favor, let us know where it is.

turns.speaker: GAFF
turns.text: Severed spine.  You'd better get in here.  Bryant's waiting for you.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: I'll see you in a minute.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Is this to be an empathy test?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Capillary dilation of the so-called blush response?  Plus fluctuation of the pupil, plus involuntary dilation of the iris?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: May I ask a personal question?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Have you ever retired a human by mistake?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: But in your profession that is a risk.

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: Nothing is infallible, but so far the Voight-Kampff scale bas been foolproof.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Like you said, Mr. Deckard, a machine can be a hazard.  The Voight-Kampff scale is a machine, isn't it?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: One that relies on human interpretation.  Where's the subject?

turns.speaker: DECKARD
turns.text: If she is, the machine works.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: How many questions did it take?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Memory implant.  She was programmed. But I think she has transcended her conditioning.  I think she was beginning to suspect.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: How many questions does it usually take, Mr. Deckard?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: And how is it one man will be able to cover so much ground?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: All pertinent information is being fed into your departmental computer, an Esper 231 -- I believe -- and a photo over-lay packet is being produced.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Let's keep our eyes on the road, Deckard.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We're going to have to start the sequence again if you don't stay with me, Deckard.  Concentrate.

turns.speaker: DECKARD'S VOICE
turns.text: How do you know I'm not?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You're not responding to the stimulus.  I can see right here, I'm not getting a reading.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I kinda get nervous when I take tests.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Already had I.Q. test this year -- but I don't think I never had a...

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Reaction time is a factor in this, so please pay attention.  Answer quickly as you can.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: You're in a desert, walking along in the sand when all of a sudden you look down and see a...

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Doesn't make any difference what desert -- it's completely hypothetical.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: But how come I'd be there?

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: Maybe you're fed up, maybe you want to be by yourself -- who knows.  So you look down and see a tortoise.  It's crawling towards you...

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: But I understand what you mean.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: You reach down and flip the tortoise over on its back, Leon.

turns.speaker: HOLDEN
turns.text: I mean you're not helping! Why is that, Leon?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How come you were in my truck?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: I was tired and didn't have any place to go.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: I have some, but I have to find out where they are staying.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: We scared each other pretty good didn't we?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I've got stuff.  If you wanna go to my place?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: And you live in this building all by yourself?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yeah, I live here pretty much alone right now...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: My glands.  They grow old too fast.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: Is that why you're still here?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes.  I couldn't pass the test.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ah, you get hold of your friends?

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: As a matter of fact I did.  They've got some work to do tonight, but they're gonna come tomorrow.

turns.speaker: PRIS
turns.text: Sebastian doesn't like to go out too much.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I keep a lot of provisions right here.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I was wondering if you might help me. I...I seem to have lost my Congressional Medal of Honor somewhere around here.

turns.speaker: MISS SWEET
turns.text: Oh, now, that's a great one!

turns.speaker: MISS SWEET
turns.text: We work on Rodeo Drive.  But we're both professional dancers.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, I'm not! My mom taught me.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: She is a dancer! And a lovely one! You would like her very much! Shall we dance?

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: Very well, thank you. I'm with the County Family Services Department. Eve tells me you've been living in a bomb shelter most of your life.

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: Adam, I'd like to introduce you to my associate -- Mr. Brown.

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: We want you to come with us so we can talk some more about your experiences.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I thank you very much for the invitation, but I'm quite busy today. Perhaps I could see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: The key to my hotel room!  I want you to have my baseball cards!  And please be sure to pay my bill!

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: I do fine, Adam.  How 'bout yourself?  You doin' any good?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: But I do miss that green sport coat of yours.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Thank you very much. But, Cliff, that's my seat. And I was just--

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: How 'bout a drink at the bar?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Eve, I don't mean to be rude, and please excuse me Cliff, but Eve, isn't Cliff just a butt with hair?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm sorry, and legs. Legs, butt and hair.  Well, isn't he?  And shallow, as well?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Cliff, I must warn you. I know how to defend myself.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Maybe we shouldn't fight at all. Fighting is pretty immature.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It certainly is.  I agree with you completely.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No.  I'm from out of town.  I'm here on business.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, your business must not be sports memorabilia, because this one Mantle card right here--  --is worth six thousand dollars all by its little self.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No, you get out of here.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Come on, Heathcliff, I'll walk you to the corner.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.  But my name is Adam.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: We? I'm going home. And, judging by that coat, I'd say you have to get back to the barber college.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Say,...did you just lose your job because of me?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Forget it.  I'm sick of working for that dickhead.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: A walking penis capable of intelligent speech.  A dickhead.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I just had a mental picture of...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't know. Why doesn't it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, I guess because I'm a little psychic...I have this thing.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Let me guess something. This is your first visit to La La Land. You're staying somewhere over in Hollywood because, like an idiot, you thought that would be an exciting place to stay.  Right so far?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I knew it! So anyhow, you get on a bus and before you know it, you're out here in the San Fernando Valley without a clue.  Which brings us to here.  Correct again?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Where are you staying? The Holiday Inn?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes! Yes! The Holiday Inn! That's exactly right!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: See? I'm psychic. Not completely, but pretty much. That was pretty good, wasn't it?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah. Thanks. Anyhow, let me predict a bus for you to get on.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm not taking you there, Sweetie. Rule Number One in North America: No strangers in the car.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: If it will make you feel any better, I don't have a gun.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, that changes everything. Get the fuck away from me!!  I mean it!!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm sorry!  I said something wrong, didn't I!  Please forgive me!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Wait! Please wait!  I'll make a deal with you!  I'll give you a Rogers Hornsby, if you'll take me to the hotel!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: He's all yours. I was holding him back.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Rogers Hornsby's worth like four thousand dollars!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So what?!  I've got two of him!  And this many DiMaggios and Robinsons. I was holding these out, too.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So for four thousand dollars, all I have to do is drive you to your hotel?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I don't have to take a physical in your space ship?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Okay.  What the hell?  You got a deal. Get in.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So...Mister Andretti, your first time on the freeway?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Mind if I change the station? Better traffic reports on AM.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Perry Como!  You had him!  Go back! Go back!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yeah! Listen to this part. This is where it really takes off!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I can't help it. Perry Como always does this to me! I just get so cranked!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That was...wonderful!  I've never felt anything like that in my life.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah, same here. Don't forget your suitcase.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I am so glad to see you!!  I thought I'd never see you again!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Okay, down boy.  I can't take this for driving you home. I wish I could, but I can't. So here, take it back. I could have just left it for you at the desk, but it's very valuable. Now take it.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh. Okay. Well, so long. Enjoy your visit.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Please don't follow me.  Don't do it!
